class.name: GoostMath
class.description: The singleton which provides various mathematical functions.

method.name: bezier
method.description: Interpolates a cubic Bézier curve between the four control points [code]a[/code], [code]ac[/code], [code]bc[/code], [code]b[/code]. Points [code]ac[/code] and [code]bc[/code] provide directional information, and the distance between these points determines how fast the curve moves towards [code]ac[/code] before turning towards [code]bc[/code]. The following types are supported: [float], [Vector2], [Vector3].

method.name: catmull_rom
method.description: Interpolates a centripetal Catmull–Rom spline between the four control points [code]ac[/code], [code]a[/code], [code]b[/code], [code]bc[/code]. Points [code]ac[/code] and [code]bc[/code] provide directional information, and the interpolated values lie between [code]a[/code] and [code]b[/code] points. The following types are supported: [float], [Vector2], [Vector3].

method.name: is_between
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if [code]s[/code] lies between [code]a[/code] and [code]b[/code] values. Here, "between" means that [code]s[/code] lies within the range of [code][a, b][/code] [b]or[/b] [code][b, a][/code] ranges, so [code]a[/code] and [code]b[/code] should not be seen as min and max values, but rather as two extremes of the range. Values are compared using non-strict inequality. If [code]a[/code] and [code]b[/code] are the same, then [code]s[/code] will still return [code]true[/code] if [code]s[/code] equals to [code]a[/code] and [code]b[/code].

method.name: is_equal_approx
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if [code]a[/code] and [code]b[/code] are approximately equal to each other. Here, approximately equal means that [code]a[/code] and [code]b[/code] are within [code]tolerance[/code] of each other. Infinity values of the same sign are considered equal.

method.name: is_zero_approx
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if [code]s[/code] is zero or almost zero. This method is faster than using [method is_equal_approx] with one value as zero.

method.name: log
method.description: Computes logarithm of [code]x[/code] with arbitrary base. If [code]base[/code] is not specified, returns natural logarithm of [code]x[/code].
